newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Shell Malaysia to sign loan facility.
newsitem.headline: Shell Malaysia to sign loan facility.

text.p: Malaysia's Shell Refining Co Bhd said it will on Wednesday sign a $360 million facility agreement with a group of 12 offshore banks for the building of a Long Residue Catalytic Cracking complex (LRCC).
The facility was arranged by Standard Chartered Bank Malaysia Bhd and Arab-Malaysian Merchant Bank Bhd, Shell said in a note to the media on Monday.
Shell Refining is a unit of Royal Dutch/Shell Group.
The Malaysian unit is building the $402 million LRCC which will be attached to its refinery in Port Dickson in central Negeri Sembilan state. The plant is scheduled for completion in 1999.
Shell did not say how it would take to raise the balance of the funding for the plant and company officials were not available for comment.
The LRCC will be built by Japan's JGC Corp and will expand Shell's capacity to at least 150,000 barrels a day from the present 105,000.
